author: Special Correspondent
text:
A large number of TNGEA activists courted arrest on Friday after blocking a road in Erode.– PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

Members of various government employees associations block road in Salem on Friday.– Photo: E. Lakshmi narayanan

A total of 2,277 government employees including 1,927 women were arrested on Friday for blocking a road to press a charter of demands.

The arrested employees affiliated to the Tamil Nadu Government Employees’ Association (TNGEA) were housed in five marriage halls and released later in the day, the police said.

Functioning of government offices were affected.

Salem

Government employees who are on an indefinite strike intensified the agitation on Friday by blocking roads in Salem, and Namakkal.

Over 1,600 staff participated in the agitation in these two districts. The strike began on February 10 with the demand to increase salary, implementation of old pension scheme, among others.

The strike has affected the functioning of various departments at the Collectorate.

On Friday, employees of various government associations gathered in large numbers near the Collectorate. They raised slogans and later blocked the road near Collectorate. This resulted in traffic block. The police removed 641 employees, including 355 women employees.

In Namakkal district, members of Tamil Nadu Government Employees Association (TNGEA) blocked the Park Road. The police removed 1,110 employees, including 990 women employees.
title: 2,277 government employees arrested
